title: 108_s771
content: The Act may be cited as the "Victims of Child Abuse Act of 2003" and includes amendments to the Victims of Child Abuse Act of 1990. The Victims of Child Abuse Act of 1990 is amended to include the National Children's Alliance (NCA) as a not-for-profit organization supporting Children's Advocacy Centers (CACs) nationwide. CACs are community partnerships dedicated to improving responses to child abuse. Children's Advocacy Centers (CACs) are community partnerships committed to a multidisciplinary team approach in child abuse investigations. They are based in child-friendly facilities to facilitate collaboration among law enforcement, prosecutors, child protective services, and medical/mental health professionals. Regional Children's Advocacy Centers, established by the Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention, offer support and resources for communities developing CACs. Children's Advocacy Centers provide support for child abuse investigations through multidisciplinary collaboration among agencies. Regional Children's Advocacy Centers offer assistance in establishing and coordinating child-focused programs. The Administrator of the Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention will establish Regional Children's Advocacy Centers to focus on child victims by assisting communities in developing and maintaining local Children's Advocacy Centers. The Administrator, in consultation with the National Children's Alliance, will solicit proposals for assistance under this section when existing contracts with Regional Children's Advocacy Centers are close to expiration. The Administrator shall select proposals for funding that meet specific criteria. The Administrator will make grants for local child abuse investigation programs in consultation with the Office of Victims of Crime. The National Children's Alliance will manage the funds. Authorization of $15,000,000 for fiscal years 2004 through 2008 for sections 213 and 214. Authorized $5,000,000 annually for section 214A for fiscal years 2004 through 2008.
